messages.title: Tackling Fake News
messages.content:
One of the hazards of modern social media is that all sorts of inaccuracies become widespread. Let's bust some myths! 
 - Flick will try to attempt to repeal the hunting ban. Repeal is not Conservative Party policy and will not be. 
 - The UK is one of the leading nations when it comes to refugees from the Syrian crisis in terms of the numbers we take and the support we provide. - UK jobs aren't going overseas. Unemployment is down; growth in our economy is up. 
 - Conservative policies have been good for Portsmouth – unemployment is down, growth in our economy is up, more homes are being built, more jobs are to come. 
 - HMS Queen Elizabeth arrives later this summer. We are buying 138 of the F-35B Joint Strike Fighter jets for the Fleet Air Arm and RAF. Work starts on our new Type 26 frigates in July. 
 - Our plans for social care will be fairer than the current model, which cannot continue. Our proposed policy will allow you to pass on more of your home to your family than at present. We will be consulting widely including with Parliament and the media.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Education is at the heart of my Plan for Portsmouth. The new funding formula will mean that Portsmouth schools are set to receive an extra £12M. I often speak in support of our schools in Parliament and everyone is grateful for the hard work and dedication of our teachers.

Our plans for social care will be fairer than the current model, which cannot continue. Our proposed policy will allow you to pass on more of your home to your family than at present. We will be consulting widely including with Parliament and the media.

issues.defence: HMS Queen Elizabeth arrives later this summer and we are buying 138 of the F-35B Joint Strike Fighter jets for the Fleet Air Arm and RAF. Work starts on our new Type 26 frigates in July.
issues.economy: UK jobs aren't going overseas. Unemployment is down; growth in our economy is up.
issues.education: Education is at the heart of my Plan for Portsmouth. The new funding formula will mean that Portsmouth schools are set to receive an extra £12M. I often speak in support of our schools in Parliament and everyone is grateful for the hard work and dedication of our teachers.
issues.health: We will be speaking to the Department of Health again straight after the election.

leaflet.personalStatement: I want to continue to work hard for Portsmouth South. If re-elected, I will work to ensure that we get our share of government investment so that local people have the opportunities they need for their careers and their families.

contactInformation.address: Unit 4, Cumberland Business Park, Northumberland Road, Southsea PO5 1DS

images.caption: Education is the key to our children's future
